tentpole_structure.description: Load-bearing plot moments that support entire narrative structure
tentpole_structure.spacing_principle: Tentpoles spaced to maintain momentum - ~6 chapters between major revelations
tentpole_structure.function: Each tentpole irreversibly changes story's direction, makes return to previous status quo impossible

tentpoles.title: Timestamp Discrepancies
tentpoles.function: Introduce protagonist, establish world, plant central mystery
tentpoles.core_event: Lira discovers ansible messages from Earth don't align with light-speed verification data
reveals_to_reader: Ansible technology and its operation
Lira's precision and investigative nature
The isolation-despite-connection paradox of human colonies
Something is wrong with Earth's messages
plants_for_later: Specific timestamp examples Lira will reference throughout investigation
Her brother's death in colonial war (motivation)
Guild's hierarchical structure and information control
Light-delay verification as key evidence method
tentpoles.emotional_beat: Lira's quiet horror as her trusted system shows cracks
tentpoles.world_establishes: Ansible technology, colonial isolation, relativistic travel, guild power
tentpoles.tone: Paranoid thriller - something's wrong but can't prove it yet
tentpoles.chapter_end: Lira decides to investigate covertly, knowing this could destroy her career

tentpoles.title: Physical Evidence Arrives
tentpoles.function: Confirm suspicions with unalterable proof, form partnership, escalate stakes
tentpoles.core_event: Kaito arrives with physical data from Earth relay station that directly contradicts ansible messages sent on same dates
reveals_to_reader: Ansible messages can be falsified
Physical evidence takes decades to arrive (relativistic delay)
Kaito's background and witness status
Conspiracy is real and systematic, not just errors
plants_for_later: Kaito's ship logs from Earth orbit
Physical data core he's been carrying
His relationship with relativistic trader clans
Mention of Earth's 'final days' without details
tentpoles.emotional_beat: Lira's validation turns to fear - if messages are false, everything is
tentpoles.world_establishes: Relativistic trade, time dilation effects, physical vs informational truth
tentpoles.chapter_end: Lira and Kaito form partnership to uncover full scope of deception

tentpoles.title: The Scale of Manipulation
tentpoles.function: Reveal conspiracy isn't error but systematic policy, transform understanding
tentpoles.core_event: Lira accesses guild's hidden archives, discovers ansible operators have been modifying messages for decades to prevent colonial conflicts
reveals_to_reader: Message modification is deliberate guild policy, not rogue operator
Guild sees itself as peacekeepers, not deceivers
Scale: thousands of modified messages over 40+ years
Historical events everyone believes may be fabrications
plants_for_later: Specific pattern: all Earth messages go through single checkpoint
References to 'the silence protocol' without explanation
Mention of Earth going 'unstable' 40 years ago
Ryn's name on most of the modification orders
tentpoles.emotional_beat: Lira's world inverts - not exposing crime but threatening 'necessary evil'
tentpoles.world_establishes: Guild's role as hidden government, information as power, fabricated history
tentpoles.tone: Philosophical horror - what if the lie is holding civilization together?
tentpoles.chapter_end: Lira realizes Ryn, her mentor, is at the center of the conspiracy

tentpoles.title: Earth's Silence
tentpoles.function: Deliver major revelation that recontextualizes entire investigation
tentpoles.core_event: Lira confronts Ryn, forces access to deepest archives: Earth's ansible went silent 40 years ago, guild has been fabricating ALL Earth messages since
reveals_to_reader: Earth has been silent for 40 years - no one knows what happened
Every 'Earth message' for 40 years has been fabricated by guild
Human civilization based on fiction of Earth's guidance
Ryn and guild chose deception over civilization collapse
plants_for_later: WHY Earth went silent (Book 2 revelation)
Earth's final authentic message (Book 2)
Alien contact as cause (Book 2)
Harvester threat (Book 3)
tentpoles.emotional_beat: Lira's betrayal and Ryn's tragic justification - both believe they're right
tentpoles.world_establishes: Fragility of human unity, power of consensus reality
tentpoles.tone: Tragic confrontation - no villains, only impossible choices
tentpoles.chapter_end: Lira chooses truth over stability, begins broadcasting revelation

tentpoles.title: Fracture
tentpoles.function: Show consequences of truth, set up Book 2, establish new status quo
tentpoles.core_event: Truth spreads to multiple colonies, civilization fragments as different colonies accept or reject revelation, information warfare erupts, Lira becomes fugitive and reluctant revolutionary
reveals_to_reader: Truth doesn't unite, it fractures - colonies react differently
Some colonies believe Lira, some believe guild, some believe neither
Information warfare: competing narratives, no trusted source
Lira's personal cost: exile, fugitive status, burden of responsibility
plants_for_later: Colonial wars starting (Book 2 focus)
Contact vs Memory factions forming
Guild's deeper secrets still hidden
Zara's alien signal detection gaining importance
tentpoles.emotional_beat: Lira's hollow victory - truth told but civilization fragmenting because of it
tentpoles.world_establishes: Post-revelation chaos, death of shared reality
tentpoles.tone: Pyrrhic victory - right action, terrible consequences
tentpoles.chapter_end: Lira in hiding, watching civilization fracture, questioning if truth was worth the cost. But deeper truth about WHY Earth went silent still unknown.

causal_chains.connection: Suspicion requires validation - Kaito provides unalterable proof

causal_chains.from: Ch7: Ansible messages can be falsified
causal_chains.connection: Individual falsification leads to institutional policy revelation
Pattern of modification conceals ultimate secret - Earth is gone
Loss of shared origin story destroys consensus reality

revelation_escalation: Ch17: Earth is gone, everything is fiction (existential)
Ch20: Truth destroys what lies built (consequences)

writing_guidelines.pacing: Each tentpole must feel inevitable yet surprising - readers sense something coming but not exactly what
writing_guidelines.revelation_technique: Show evidence before interpretation - let readers piece together with Lira
writing_guidelines.emotional_authenticity: Lira's reactions must feel real - shock, denial, bargaining, acceptance
avoid: Convenient discoveries - make Lira work for each revelation
Clear villains - everyone believes they're doing right thing
